author: Budget-Cow-8256
title: Is it really a bad idea to opt out of a workplace pension?
body:
I’m currently paying 6.5%, which amounts to about £135 a month.

I’ll be honest, I know people say it’s a bad idea and to think long-term, but I’m struggling to do so at the minute with the cost of everything rising. I live on my own and things are a bit tight at the minute and that £135 could make a measurable difference to my current life, and so it’s difficult to follow the ‘Yeah, but think about when you’re retired in 40 years time’ train of thought. 

I’m not definitely set on it, because I do obviously see and acknowledge the benefits, but it’s becoming harder to justify. 

Anyone thinking the same?

Edit: Thanks everyone for the advice. I’m going to look into my options and see whether reducing contributions might be possible.

author: indigotock
title: Full-time student due to start a full-time job soon. What do I need to know?
body:
I'm half way through my fourth and final year at university and I've just got a full time job which I plan on staying in for a little bit after I graduate (to save some money, etc). What will change or what should I know with regard to things like income/council tax?

This is my first *real* job so I'm just trying to get everything cleared up, and different people are giving me different answers :(. Any help would be appreciated!

author: dqingqong
title: Tax and duty on goods brought to the UK from outside the European Union
body:
I am abroad student studying in the UK, and I don't know about tax and duty rules when importing goods from outside the EU. So, what is the customs duty limit when ordering from the US? I am thinking about importing a pair of shoes which is going to cost $109 ~ £65. Is this parcel reliable for customs duty and VAT, or would it slip through the customs?

Thanks!

author: Hamsternoir
title: Who's applied for a self employed grant from the HMRC?
body: I'm trying to work out how eligible I am, I'm doing less work due to the kids being about and some projects being delayed until much later in the year so I'll probably end up with the same amount of income on average over the tax year but don't know if I should apply as I'm still doing some work. I just wondered what the views of others was before I applied.
